data.name: Healthcare.gov
data.description: Federal Affordable Care Act (ACA) website. Call 1-855-733-3711 to schedule an appointment with a Federal navigator.

data.name: NC LINKS
data.description: For young adults with previous engagement in the North Carolina foster care program, NC LINKS may be able to provide financial and other assistance for post-secondary education.

data.name: National Reentry Resource Center - Housing Page
data.description: Funded and administered by the U.S. Department of Justice’s Bureau of Justice Assistance (BJA), the National Reentry Resource Center (NRRC) shared information and guidance on a variety of reentry issues.

data.name: Other listings
data.description: There are many other listings on the 211 site – use their search function to explore other topics and to look for resources in other counties.

data.name: The NCWorks Career Center
data.description: Career centers and online resources for finding work. The site has a comprehensive list of the Career Centers in each county.

data.name: Former Offender Initiative
data.description: North Carolina Department of Commerce initiative to help job seekers who have criminal records overcome barriers to employment

data.name: Goodwill Industries International
data.description: Goodwill Industries provides training and job services. You can search for a Goodwill in your area by checking the Job & Career Support box at the top of the page under the main menu and entering your city or town in the search box.

data.name: Lionheart.org
data.description: Lionheart offers emotional literacy programs that can help better the lives of individuals and families.

data.name: Bonds4jobs.com
data.description: Bonds4jobs.com is a free government service "safety net" giving employers access to job seekers who may be at a hiring disadvantage.

data.name: NC Peer Support Specialist Program
data.description: This program brings people living in recovery who have a mental illness or substance abuse disorder to provide support to others who can benefit from their lived experiences. They are certified by the State to provide support to others with mental health or substance use disorders.

data.name: NC Vocational Rehabilitation Services
data.description: Vocational Rehabilitation Services provides employment assistance to those with a qualifying mental or physical disability.

data.name: Federal Work Opportunity Tax Credit
data.description: Federal Work Opportunity Tax Credit is a Federal tax credit available to employers for hiring people who face significant barriers to employment because of prior convictions.

data.name: Household Budgeting Worksheet
data.description: This worksheet from the budgeting section of ConsumerCredit.com can help with responsible financial planning.

data.name: NC Health & Human Services Local Offices
data.description: This page links to all county HHS websites. The sites offer information on Public Assistance, Public Health, Social Work Services, Veterans Benefits, children services, Medicaid and more.

data.name: FTC Consumer Website
data.description: The FTC Consumer Website provides information ranging from jobs and money making tips, identity theft prevention, home buying and renting, health and fitness, and money and credit strategies, as well as tips on how to dispute credit card and other billing errors.

data.name: Assurance Wireless
data.description: Assurance Wireless offers free phones and limited free voice/text to certain low-income households who qualify.

data.name: Community Success Initiative
data.description: The mission of the Community Success Initiative organization is to help individuals and communities be aware of personal growth and “success” principles, inspire others to reach their potential, and help to build vibrant and healthy communities. This website has a great resource page.

data.name: Coastal Horizons
data.description: Coastal Horizons Center offers a critical link between the criminal justice system and treatment services. The primary functions of TASC are: to provide screening and assessment for those referred, provide referral and linkage to treatment services needed, ensure access to available services, as well as monitor and report treatment progress to the referring agent.

data.name: The Center for Community Transitions
data.description:
The Center for Community Transitions (CCT) offers three main programs to address the needs of those incarcerated or recently released from incarceration:
  • The Center for Women is a 30-bed residential facility for women serving out the final years of their prison sentences. The foundational offering at the Center for Women is the work-release program, guiding women towards a place of productive living and independence.
  • Lifeworks! is the longest running program of the organization and focuses on helping individuals with criminal records navigate the process of attaining and retaining employment.
  • Families Doing Time is a program that is designed to help strengthen family bonds between an incarcerated loved one and her family and interrupt the cycle of intergenerational incarceration.

data.name: Project Re-Entry
data.description: PROJECT RE-ENTRY assists former offenders returning to the community after serving prison sentences in avoiding the potential pitfalls associated with life after incarceration. The mission of the program is to improve the reintegration of ex-offenders, reduce criminal justice cost, and increase public safety. Project Re-Entry begins working with inmates prior to their release through a structured, group-based curriculum that is offered in designated state prison facilities. In addition to providing valuable information and education, pre-release sessions also allow Project Re-Entry staff to build trust and familiarity with inmates as they attempt to reconnect with the “outside” world. Inmates begin to think beyond the prison walls, overcome their own emotional barriers, and learn how to build healthy human connections.Along with the pre-release curriculum, Project Re-Entry also provides a variety of post-release services to pre-release program graduates after their release. Services address issues such as employment, education, deinstitutionalization, counseling, substance abuse, transportation, and family reintegration.

data.name: Literacy Council of Buncombe County
data.description: The Literacy Council of Buncombe County provides specialized tutoring and resources in literacy.

data.name: AB Tech
data.description: AB Tech is the local community college.

data.name: Julian F. Keith Alcohol & Drug Abuse Treatment Center (ADATC)
Insight Human Services, Swain Recovery Center
Asheville Housing Authority
data.description: The Housing Authority of the City of Asheville strives to serve its residents by providing an affordable home and avenues to self-sufficiency.

data.name: FIRST at Blue Ridge, Inc
data.description: FIRST at Blue Ridge is a State of North Carolina licensed Residential Therapeutic Community for men and women with chronic substance use disorders. The program’s mission is to provide opportunity and guidance to those with addictions and assist them to make positive life changes in order to become responsible and productive members of society. The program includes classes, recovery meetings, individual and/or group therapy sessions, and job search assistance.

data.name: Biltmore Housing, Inc.
data.description: Biltmore Housing provides recovery-oriented supportive housing in Asheville, Arden and Hendersonville.

data.name: Homeward Bound of WNC
data.description: Homeward Bound of WNC provide assistance to the homeless regardless of criminal history or income.

data.name: North Carolina Coalition to End Homelessness
data.description: NCCEH works with communities to address root causes of homelessness by developing and implementing data-driven strategies that are focused on permanent housing and appropriate services.

data.name: Women in Transition Program
data.description: The Women in Transition Program of the YWCA Central Carolinas provides safe housing for single, unaccompanied women.

data.name: NC LINKS
data.description: NC LINKS is a program for young adults with previous engagement in the foster care program.

data.name: SocialServe.com
data.description: Socialserve.com is a free housing locator service that covers most areas in North Carolina.

data.name: Project Reentry
data.description: Project ReEntry (make sure you click on "Previously Incarcerated") provides transition services up to 18 months before release and long-term services afterward, including job services and training through Goodwill. E-mail tfultz@goodwillwnc.org or call (336) 724-3625 ext. 1332 for more information.

data.name: Green Opportunities
data.description: Green Opportunities offers job training for everyone. There are multiple opportunities, including restaurant job skills training and construction, as well as general employment skills support. Check out some of the free classes offered in partnership with A-B Tech for qualified applicants.

data.name: Eliada ESTA Program
data.description: The ESTA program trains and equips students, 16 to 22 years old, who face significant challenges, helping them discover and reach their fullest potential.

data.name: Mountain Area Workforce Development Board
data.description: General employment assistance.

data.name: Re-Entry Mediation for Women
data.description: Imagine that you are about to walk out into the world with no car, no job, nowhere to live, and you don’t know who – if anyone – is willing to help you get back on your feet?  What’s it like for a woman – a mom, a daughter, a spouse – to walk into the world after 2 years, 10 years, or 20 years behind bars? The Mediation Center provides an opportunity for women within 6 months of release from prison to meet with the people they will need to depend upon on the outside.

data.name: Exodus Homes
data.description: Exodus Homes provides transitional to permanent supportive housing for homeless recovering addicts, alcoholics, and ex-offenders. Residents come from treatment programs, detox centers, hospitals, prisons, jails, homeless shelters, and other settings. Exodus Homes actively fosters leadership development among our residents whenever possible and appropriate.

data.name: FIRST at Blue Ridge, Inc.
data.description: FIRST at Blue Ridge is a State of North Carolina licensed Residential Therapeutic Community for men and women with chronic substance use disorders. The program’s mission is to provide opportunity and guidance to those with addictions and assist them to make positive life changes in order to become responsible and productive members of society. The program includes classes, recovery meetings, individual and/or group therapy sessions, and job search assistance.

data.name: Sunrise Community
data.description: Sunrise Community for Recovery and Wellness advocates for and supports persons transitioning from detention or institutions, or persons struggling with mental health/substance disorders while enhancing their self-efficacy, autonomy and equality.

data.name: Project Re-Entry
data.description: As part of Project Re-Entry, there are Reentry Services for Buncombe County available at the courthouse located at 60 Court Plaza.
